block.p: Maria A. DaBreo, the daughter of Gloria DaBreo and Brian DaBreo, both of Brooklyn, is to be married today to Jamahl Kwanza Ernest Evans, the son of Judi Adams-Evans of New Haven and Ernest Evans of Manhattan. The Rev. Jean-Miguel Auguste is to perform the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Cathedral Basilica of St. James in Brooklyn.

Mrs. DaBreo-Evans, 28, is an associate at Umeugo & Associates, a law firm in West Haven, Conn. She graduated from Spelman College and New York Law School. Her mother is a social worker at Angel Guardian Children's and Family Services, a social services agency in Brooklyn. Her father is the vault coordinator in Brooklyn for Brink's.

Maria A. DaBreo, the daughter of Gloria DaBreo and Brian DaBreo, both of Brooklyn, is to be married today to Jamahl Kwanza Ernest Evans, the son of Judi Adams-Evans of New Haven and Ernest Evans of Manhattan. The Rev. Jean-Miguel Auguste is to perform the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Cathedral Basilica of St. James in Brooklyn.

Mrs. DaBreo-Evans, 28, is an associate at Umeugo & Associates, a law firm in West Haven, Conn. She graduated from Spelman College and New York Law School. Her mother is a social worker at Angel Guardian Children's and Family Services, a social services agency in Brooklyn. Her father is the vault coordinator in Brooklyn for Brink's.

Mr. Evans, 28, is a recruiter for the law school at Quinnipiac University in Hamden, Conn. He graduated from Morehouse College and received a law degree from Quinnipiac. His mother, who is retired, taught the sixth grade at Public School 92 in Manhattan. His father is an analyst at Fahnstock & Company, an investment management company in Manhattan.
